MC> On Aug 23, 2004, at 4:52 PM, Timothy N. Jones wrote:

>> Is anyone aware of a server-side mock/stub/whatever store and/or
>> transport for JavaMail?� I'd like to develop some unit tests for my
>> client-side code that could run even if a mail server was not running.
>> Something like the DSML JNDI provider which I use for LDAP testing 
>> would
>> be ideal.

MC> Coincidentally, I just posted a blog on how I tested JavaMail:

MC> �� http://www.clarkware.com/cgi/blosxom/2004/08/23#DumbsterDiving


And more along that line, I have a simple mailing list server that I
developed test-first here:
http://www.objectmentor.com/resources/downloads/index  The download is
called "Zess"

I didn't need to mock anything, I just tested the pieces in isolation
and then end to end using a marker on the subject line so that I could
differentiate the messages I sent myself from all of the other spam
:-)


Michael Feathers
author, Working Effectively with Legacy Code (Prentice Hall 2004)
